data.text: @PittsburghPG How about the other 30,000 or so people in Allegheny County who died during this time?   Do their stories matter?

@PittsburghPG Allegheny County has a population of 1.2 million people and averages 1,1000 deaths/month. 

3,000 is 0.025% of the population. 

They put us through the ringer for 0.025%. 

And save the 'but restrictions' because the 0.025% tracked since the very beginning.
@PittsburghPG Will you also accept stories about the death of reason and common sense?
